meanings.definition: Covered or filled with a soft material to make it thicker or softer.
meanings.sent1: The padded chair was very comfortable to sit on.
meanings.sent2: She wore a padded jacket to keep warm in the winter.
meanings.sent3: The padded pillow felt like a cloud under his head.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt padded with love after spending time with her family.
meanings.sent5: The padded walls in the room made it cozy and quiet.

meanings.definition: To walk with a soft, muffled sound.
meanings.sent1: The cat padded quietly across the room.
meanings.sent2: He padded down the hallway in his slippers.
meanings.sent3: The detective padded around the crime scene looking for clues.
meanings.sent4: Her footsteps padded softly on the forest floor.
meanings.sent5: The dancer padded gracefully across the stage.

meanings.definition: To add unnecessary or false details to a story or account.
meanings.sent1: She padded her essay with extra words to meet the word count.
meanings.sent2: The author padded the book with irrelevant descriptions.
meanings.sent3: He padded his resume with fake qualifications.
meanings.sent4: The speaker padded his speech with exaggerated anecdotes.
meanings.sent5: The student padded his presentation with unnecessary slides.
